opendial.bn.nodes

Class ActionNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.nodes.BNode
      • opendial.bn.nodes.ActionNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<BNode>

    public class ActionNode
extends BNode
    Representation of an action node (sometimes also called decision node). An action node is defined as a set of mutually exclusive action values.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-12-05 20:12:33 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      Creates a new action node with a unique identifier, and no values
      ActionNode(java.lang.String nodeId, java.util.Set<Value> actionValues)
      Creates a new action node with a unique identifier and a set of values

      • getFactor

        public java.util.Map<Assignment,java.lang.Double> getFactor()
        Returns the factor matrix for the action node. The matrix lists the possible actions for the node, along with a uniform probability distribution over its values
        Specified by:
        getFactor in class BNode
        Returns:
        the factor matrix corresponding to the node

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Value actionValue)
        Returns a probability uniformly distributed on the alternative values.
        Parameters:
        actionValue - the value to check
        Returns:
        1/|values|

      • copy

        public ActionNode copy()
        Copies the action node. Note that only the node content is copied, not its connection with other nodes.
